Content:
Yes, I like both. However, I've never owned a bike new enough to sport the newer gauges.

New gauges: more info can be displayed.
Worries: display will go dim as it ages, cost a fortune to replace/repair. Used replacement will be nla, even at salvage yards. Probably go bad just after the warranty expires.

Old analog gauges: not as accurate easier to read, (angle not as important) can change background color with bulb "sock"
Can be rebuilt(?)
